properties.name: Berlin
properties.description: Posted by Colettesimsberlin, germanyI was in Berlin this summer for a long weekend. It rained the entire time, but I was more interested in the history of this city. You cannot really tell anymore the difference between East and West Berlin, but stop signs are still different in those parts of the cities.

properties.name: Community Service
properties.description: Posted by Colettesimstijuana, mexicoDuring spring break I went with a church group to build a house in Mexico. One of the most fulfilling things I have ever done. It was different seeing the level of poverty in a place so close to the US.

properties.name: Friends
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsI have a friend named Maisie who I met in Austria. We always kept in close touch, and I went to visit her at University of Georgia. It was very hot, and I went to an intense football game, but the visit was a lot of fun.

properties.name: Grandma
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsMy mothers mom has now lived in Albequrque for 3 years. I like to visit her there, and we go see the Indian reservations. It is within the US, but the Southwest is very different then California.

properties.name: Grandparents and fun
properties.description: Posted by Colettesims San Francisco, CAMy mothers father and his wife live in San Francisco. My sister and I use to visit them every other month. I like to visit the city but would not want to live there. It\'s fun to ride on the cable cars and got to Pier 39 to eat fresh clam chowder. Yumm!!!

properties.name: Heritage
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsLondon My father grew up in Southern London, England. He moved to Canada at 21, then California at 24. We try to go back every other summer to visit his aunt and cousins. I love my family there and the culture, it is a dream to one day eventually live there

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsSan Carlos, CA is where I grew up. It is a suburb city about 20 minutes south of San Francisco. It is a nice middle class neighborhood, but it is a bit quant for me. I lived with my dad John and my sister Christina.

properties.name: Home away from home
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsI lived abroad in Austria from August2004 to July 2005. I lived in a small town called Altheim with a host family. I love my family and still talk to my hostmom every week. The small town is beautifull, but it gets very cold and snows a lot in the winter!

properties.name: LA
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsI have an aunt and Uncle who live in Glendale, CA. My grandmother also used to live there, so every summer and winter my sister and I would fly down to visit them. Since we were so close to LA we went all over, like to Disneyland, the Getty center, and the beach.

properties.name: Mauthausen
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsMauthausen was a concentration camp in Austria during WW2. I thought it to be important to visit a place like this because it is part of Austrian history, but I will never go again.

properties.name: Munich
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsMunich, GermanyI was in Munich this previous summer. I went with my hostmom, and we went to the Hofbrauhaus which is famous for their beer. I also was at Oktoberfest the previous year.

properties.name: Rome
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsSorry, it says Florence but this place is Rome! I was here in March 2005 for my birthday with my hostmom. It is a very old city, with lots of twists and turns. Very easy to get lost! I love how you could walk around a corner and see a 2000 year old building.

properties.name: Salzburg
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimssalzburgSalzburg was only an hour from the place I lived. I saw it in the sun, rain, snow, and windy. You can find something with Mozart on it in every single store. I love the church in this city, it is beautifull...

properties.name: The real Florence!
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsFlorence, ItalyI was here in October 2004 with my hostfamily. We drove from Austria which took 7 hours, but was WORTH IT. We drove through the alps, and the trees were changing colors, it was one of the most beautifull things I have ever seen.

properties.name: Vacation
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsMy grandparents own a timeshare on Maui. For two summers we go there for a week and spend the whole time on the beach. It is a beautifull place, I love going there on vacation.

properties.name: Week abroad
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsWhile in Austria my school did a mini-exchange with a school from the Czech Republic. I lived with a family for a week that spoke no english or german. It was an interesting experience, and this town has a very old feeling to it.

properties.name: Yosemite
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsSummer 2005 I went on a motorcycle trip with my dad for a week. Just about 200 men, a couple of women, in the remote part of Yosemite with vintage english bikes... definitly an interesting experience.

properties.name: family friends
properties.description: Posted by Colettesims My dad has friends in Ontario which he met through a motorcycle group. Our family spent Christmas 2003 with them, and then we visited Niagra Falls. It was beautifull, and made me want to see more of Canada.

properties.name: traveling...
properties.description: Posted by ColettesimsVienna, AustriaVienna is only a 3 hour train ride from where I lived. I traveled there about 5 times, and once for a whole week. This city is one of my favorite in Europe, because it feels like a combination of east and west.
